bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.div1:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF CHARLES W.NORDSTROM FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RELIEF THEREON.
NOTICE.
To Honorable W.H.Moyer, Sheriff of King County, State of Washington.
You will please take notice hereby that, Charles W.Nordstrom, now in your custody, duly petitioner the United States Circuit Court for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, seeking relief thereupon, and
Whereas, the said Writ and relief was denied, and Whereas, the said Petitioner duly moved for the right of appeal and for the transfer of his whole cause to the Supreme Court of the United States, and
Whereas, the said cause came on for argument as to the granting of the said appeal and the transfer of the whole cause to the appellate Court, and was heard upon the 3rd day of April A.D. 1897, by the Hon.C.H.Hanford, Circuit Judge, and
Whereas, after hearing said application, an order of appeal was duly granted, and the said cause was so ordered transferred to the Supreme Court of the United States, a full copy of the aforesaid proceedings and the order allowing the said appeal, being duly certified, is hereunto annexed for your information and advice.
And Whereas, under the Revised Statutes of the United States, being the laws of the United States, particularly Section 766 of the said Revised Statutes reads as follows, to-wit:
Sec.766. "Pending the proceedings on appeal in the case a mentioned in the three preceding sections, and until final judgment therein, and after final judgment of discharge, any proceeding against the
-1-
person so imprisoned or confined or restrained of his liberty, in any State Court, or by or under the authority of any State, for any matter so heard and determined, or in process of being heard and determined, under such writ of habeas corpus, shall be deemed null and void."
And Whereas, the Supreme Court of the United States, in Re Jugiro 140 U.S.295, construing the said Section, defined the same to mean, "in cases where the applicant was held in custody under the authority of a state court or state while the question as to whether his detention was in violation of the constitution, laws, or treaties of the United States was being examined by the courts of the United States having jurisdiction in the premises;" which said decision is more fully referred to in the case of In re M'Kane, 61 Fed. 205, where it was held to mean that until final decision in the Supreme Court of the United States no disturbance of the condition of the prisoner as he was at the time of the denying of the Writ can in anywise be had.
THEREFORE, You are hereby notified that you are to hold possession or custody of the said Petitioner, Charles W. Nordstrom, now in your keeping at the City of Seattle, County of King, State of Washington, in such manner as to your discretion shall seem meet and proper, in no wise assuming for any cause to execute any sentence of death whatsoever upon the said Petitioner, Charles W. Nordstrom, and you will be duly notified of any further proceeding in the premises.
You will please govern yourself accordingly:
Respectfully,
Jas. Hamilton Lewis Attorney for Petitioner.
J Henry Hemming Of Counsel.
-2-
Tx
No. 604
In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In re Application of Charles W. Nordstrom for Writ of Habeas Corpus etc,-
Notice to Sheriff
Jas. Hamilton Lewis
STRATTON, LEWIS, & GILMAN, Attorney for Petitioner
101-106 OCCIDENTAL BLOCK, SEATTLE
Copy of within received and due service of the same acknowledged this day of 1896.
Attorney for
FILED Apr 6 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT A. Reeves Ayres CLERK
By A. N. Moore DEPUTY
